wikipedia_page.main: Joseph McGhee (9 July 1929 – 17 April 2015) was a Scottish marathon runner, who won a gold medal at the 1954 British Empire and Commonwealth Games in Vancouver, Canada.

link_mentions.page: Athletics at the 1954 British Empire and Commonwealth Games
response: Jim Peters, then the world record holder in the marathon, entered the stadium some seventeen minutes ahead of his nearest rival in the Games marathon. He collapsed in his final lap of the stadium, however, and did not finish the race (which was won by Joe McGhee).Great Sporting Moments: Athletics. The Independent. Retrieved on 2010-08-30.
